newsitem.title: USA: AMC may become an acquisition target - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: AMC may become an acquisition target - WSJ.

text.p: Some investors say they've found a bargain in AMC Entertainment Inc, where the health problems of the chief executive has stirred takeover speculation, The Wall Street Journal said.

In Thursday's Heard on the Street column, the paper said the Kansas City movie theater operator, the nation's largest in revenue, is a "chronic underperformer" whose earnings often fall short of expectations.

In just the past six weeks, the column said, AMC stock has been downgraded by analysts at Lehman Brothers and PaineWebber, as the chain's costs climb amid an effort to turn its multiplex theaters into more profitable megaplexes.
But those who see value in AMC say that if Wall Street does not embrace the stock, the company might become an acquisition target, the column said.
This view is fueled by the company's announcement in January that 76-year-old CEO and controlling shareholder Stanley Durwood is battling cancer, the column said.
